The females all gather round but do indeed show respect for Talon's persona=
l space, allowing her to let Nature take its course and to be sure no one i=
nterfered with that, including Tucson himself, who is now held back by seve=
ral other females. =C2=A0He bows his head in submission, knowing that he wa=
s probably going to get an earful or a nip on the nose if he wasn't careful=
. =C2=A0He sits down, to wait until he's allowed to see Talon.

" I really =
should be in there with her, but if this is their way of life, I can not in=
terfere with it. =C2=A0Interesting though, I have to learn more about their=
 customs."
=C2=A0
Respect those as you wish to be respected.

Talon:

Talon followed the Dragon, she hardly could =
move, the pain was agonizing. She reached the place where the female dragon=

r babies be alright.

> Tucson could see that there was no time to return to =
base.  He looks around and finds a familiar cave.  They had walked a bit of=

im is enormous, and an old silver scale lies on the ground next to the open=
ing.  The young female he had seen earlier, pops her head out and senses th=
at Talon is in need of her protective services while giving birth.  She cal=
ls to her in quiet bellows.
> 
> " It's alright Talon, she's calling to you=

t a new mother and her newborns. "
>

s gather around Talon and show her to a place where she can have her baby, =
on a soft bed of discarded feathers and grasses.  Tucson is gently nudged o=
utside since males are not allowed inside until after the birth.  He waits =
outside with another older dragon.
> 
> " Wait, please, she's my wife, I ha=
ve to be there with her."
> 
> He tries to go inside but is blocked by an o=
lder female.  He lowers his head and backs up a slight.

r Dragon.. "

> > > > > > > > >

guardian, and the more offerings they gave him, he would return their kind =
gestures by offering his protection. But there is more to these paintings..=
 A strange mysterious figure, with an aura around it.. To me it seems evil.=
 Another idol, someone else to worship. .. People portrayed in black and wh=
ite.. White, meaning those who look to the Silver Dragon and black to those=
 who worship the intimidating idol.. I've seen ancient pictographs before o=
n Cybertron, and these are different but in the same format. Talon if the d=
ragon is a physical being, then this dark idol must be as well. We need to =
find it, before it lays harm to anyone."

e smile, Tucson returns the kiss and holds his wing over them to provide a =

se creatures are curious about us but it appears as if they're here to admi=
re rather than attack. I wonder... "

 > > > He stands up and gets back into beast mode, and sits down once more.=
 The creatures draw closer to him and sit beside him and Talon. It was clea=
r that the Silver Dragon was a source of comfort to these creatures, but th=
at was about to change once he and Talon left for Cybertron. It was a massi=
ve guilt slammed upon his heart. Yet how could he get the animals to unders=
tand that he had to leave them in such a short time? He was now their guard=
ian and they were looking up to him for protection. 
> > > > > > > > > > > =

> > > > > > > > > > > " Talon, these creatures remember the old dragon tha=
t sought to their protection and realize that I have taken his place. It's =
as I thought, they aren't aware of who we really are, and where we are from=
. They will not understand that we must leave them shortly, for good, and P=
rimus knows what will happen to them once we leave. ... Talon, I hear somet=
hing coming. It's not a Predacon but it's a fairly large creature."
> > > >=
 > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > Not far from them, Tucson spots the s=
cales of a rather large reptile, that appears to be fishing in the stream n=
ext to them. He watches attentively and at that moment, the creature lifts =
its head. It was another dragon. Yet this one was a bit smaller than he was=
, but the same coloration. He takes note of its slender shape. It was femal=
e. She looks to him as he looks to her. She slowly approaches him and they =
look gently to each other like brother and sister. In draconic vocalization=
, Tucson explains who he is and his dilemma. She intern rumbles back and bo=
ws her head. She nods as he does. It was their way of communicating as Tucs=
on looks back to Talon.
> > > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > " Appa=
rently the old dragon has family here. They are scattered but they exist. A=
nd she said that she will protect these creatures and this land along with =
her brethren for as long as they live. And she wishes us good luck on our j=
ourney."
> > > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > With that, the dragon=
ess leaves them peacefully to enjoy their time together. With a gentile gro=
an, the creatures too, depart. It was truly a spiritual moment for both of =
them.

 > > > > > > " Like a branch on a tree that has broken off during a storm a=
nd regrows in a different direction than it had been, before it had broken =

lind, rolled on four wheels and I always seemed to be an Autobot rebel. I f=

an to change on a more positive note. You may not believe this, but you hel=
ped me to find my path, and you saw me on the right road and guided me to m=
y true fate. Soon afterwards, I became a Prime, acquired seventeen more whe=
els, and almost looked like Optimus Prime, yet different. But one thing did=
n't change, I was still battling blindness off and on. Then, a third change=
, due to extensive damage to my previous form, which could not be repaired,=
 I was guided to my final evolution, this one. All of

n tell our offspring all about this planet and it's wondrous varieties of l=
ife that live here."

mes new roman, new york, times, serif;font-size:12pt"><div><span>The female=
s all gather round but do indeed show respect for Talon's personal space, a=
llowing her to let Nature take its course and to be sure no one interfered =
with that, including Tucson himself, who is now held back by several other =
females.  He bows his head in submission, knowing that he was probably=
 going to get an earful or a nip on the nose if he wasn't careful.  He=
 sits down, to wait until he's allowed to see Talon.</span></div><div><span=
><br></span></div><div><span>" I really should be in there with her, but if=
 this is their way of life, I can not interfere with it.  Interesting =
though, I have to learn more about their customs."</span></div><div> <=

gt; > > > > > > > > " Like a branch on a tree that =
has broken off during a storm and regrows in a different direction than it =
had been, before it had broken off. I know exactly how you feel. I feel the=
 same way. At one time, I was blind, rolled on four wheels and I always see=
med to be an Autobot rebel. I fought along side with my comrades but I wasn=
't good at following orders. I was well grounded but lost at the same time.=
 Then, I met you and things began to change on a more positive note. You ma=
y not believe this, but you helped me to find my path, and you saw me on th=
e right road and guided me to my true fate. Soon afterwards, I became a Pri=
me, acquired seventeen more wheels, and almost looked like Optimus Prime, y=
et different. But one thing didn't change, I was still battling blindness o=
ff and on. Then, a third change, due to extensive damage to my previous for=
m, which could not be repaired, I was guided to
 my final evolution, this o=
ne. All of these things wouldn't have come about if I had never met you. An=
d I wouldn't have it any other way. Talon, I will miss this planet as much =
as you are, and hopefully we can tell our offspring all about this planet a=
nd it's wondrous varieties of life that live here."<br>
